negative.name: Addiction
negative.summary: Physical or psychological dependence on a substance or activity.

effects.description: Withdrawal penalty to Mental-attribute tests based on severity: Mild -2, Moderate -4, Severe -4, Burnout -6.
Withdrawal penalty to Physical-attribute tests based on severity: Mild -2, Moderate -4, Severe -4, Burnout -6.
Social penalty from obvious addiction symptoms: Severe -2, Burnout -3 (applies whether in withdrawal or not).

negative.name: Allergy
negative.summary: Allergenic reaction to a substance or condition. Karma = Commonality + Severity.

effects.description: Lose 1 die from Resistance Tests per severity level when attacked with allergen: Mild -1, Moderate -2, Severe -3, Extreme -4.

negative.name: Astral Beacon
negative.summary: Highly visible astral signature; lasts twice as long; easier to assense.

effects.description: Astral signature lasts twice as long as normal.
Others receive -1 to the threshold of Assensing Tests to gather information about your astral signature.

negative.name: Bad Luck
negative.summary: Edge occasionally backfires (1 on d6). Once per session.

effects.description: Whenever Edge is used, roll 1d6. On a result of 1, the Edge use backfires dramatically. After Bad Luck triggers once per session, no further rolls needed for remaining Edge uses.

negative.name: Bad Rep
negative.summary: Start with 3 Notoriety. Must confront source to buy off.

effects.description: Character starts play with 3 points of Notoriety.

negative.buyoffRequirement: Must confront and resolve the source of the bad reputation before buying off with Karma.

negative.name: Code of Honor
negative.summary: Will not kill or allow killing of a protected group.

effects.description: When anyone attempts to kill a member of the protected group, make a Charisma + Willpower (4) Test. Failure means the character must immediately stop the violence.
+1 Public Awareness for each protected group member left alive who can remember the character.
Each time non-lethal force is used against protected group, GM rolls 1d6. On 1, unforeseen complication occurs.
Lose 1 Karma for the adventure for each protected group member killed, whether intentionally or inadvertently.

negative.name: Codeblock
negative.summary: -2 dice on one specific Matrix action (must have a test).
negative.specificationRequirement: Must be a Matrix action with an associated test

effects.description: -2 dice pool modifier to the specified Matrix action.

negative.name: Combat Paralysis
negative.summary: First Initiative halved; –3 on Surprise tests; +1 Composure threshold under fire.

effects.description: Initiative Score is halved (rounded up) during the first Combat Turn of any combat encounter.
–3 dice pool modifier to Surprise tests.
+1 threshold modifier for Composure Tests while under fire or in combat situations.

negative.name: Dependents
negative.summary: Loved ones require time/resources. Increases lifestyle cost and skill learning time.

1.name: Occasional Nuisance
1.description: Drops in unexpectedly, needs emotional support, occasional money. Examples: slacker sibling, long-term boyfriend/girlfriend, child with visitation.

2.name: Regular Inconvenience
2.description: Needs regular attention, shares living space, gets involved in affairs. Examples: live-in partner, shared custody child, close family member.

3.name: Close Family/Life Partner
3.description: Lives with character, major strain on time/resources, may require special care. Examples: large family, elderly parents with needs, full custody children.

effects.description: Increase lifestyle cost by 10%/20%/30% per month based on rating.
Increase time to learn or improve skills by 50%.
Increase base time for long-term projects by 50%.

negative.name: Distinctive Style
negative.summary: Memorable appearance; +2 dice to identify/trace, -1 Memory threshold.

effects.description: +2 dice pool modifier for anyone attempting to identify, trace, or locate this character.
-1 to Difficulty Threshold (minimum 1) for NPCs making Memory Tests to recall information about the character.

negative.note: Physical in nature; does not apply to astral searches.

negative.name: Elf Poser
negative.summary: Human posing as an elf. Social stigma if discovered.

effects.description: Can pass as an elf and avoid negative Social modifiers associated with being non-elf.
If an elf discovers the secret, they will likely treat the character with contempt and hostility.

negative.name: Gremlins
negative.summary: Tech glitches more easily. Reduces 1s needed for glitch by rating.

effects.description: Reduce the number of 1s needed to glitch by rating when using technology. GM may require tests for normally automatic operations.

restrictions.cannotSabotage: Cannot use Gremlins offensively to damage opponent's equipment by touch.

negative.name: Incompetent
negative.summary: Treated as 'unaware' for one skill group. Cannot possess that group.

restrictions.mustBeRelevant: GM may reject choices unlikely to come up in play
restrictions.cannotPossess: Character cannot possess the affected skill group
restrictions.noGearBenefits: Gear bonuses for skills in this group provide no benefit

effects.description: Character is treated as 'unaware' for all skills in the specified skill group. Success Tests may be required for tasks others take for granted.

negative.name: Insomnia
negative.summary: Trouble sleeping affects Stun recovery and Edge refresh.

1.name: Moderate
1.onSuccess: Normal Stun recovery and Edge refresh
1.onFailure: Double Stun recovery time, no Edge refresh for up to 24 hours

2.name: Severe
2.onSuccess: Normal Stun recovery and Edge refresh
2.onFailure: No Stun recovery from rest, no Edge refresh for 24 hours

effects.description: Before rolling Body + Willpower to recover Stun damage, roll Intuition + Willpower (4).
Rating 1: Double Stun recovery time. Rating 2: No Stun recovery from rest attempt.
Edge does not refresh and may not refresh for up to 24 hours on failed test.

negative.name: Loss of Confidence
negative.summary: -2 dice for a skill you've invested in. No specialization or Edge use.

prerequisite.description: Must be a skill the character has invested in (rating 4+)

effects.description: -2 dice pool modifier to tests involving the affected skill.
Cannot use any specialization with this skill while suffering Loss of Confidence.
Edge may not be used for tests involving this skill.

negative.name: Low Pain Tolerance
negative.summary: Wound modifiers every 2 boxes instead of 3.

effects.description: Incur -1 wound modifier for every 2 boxes of cumulative damage (Physical + Stun) instead of the normal 3 boxes.

negative.name: Ork Poser
negative.summary: Human or elf posing as an ork. Social stigma if discovered.

effects.description: Can pass as an ork through cosmetic biomods (tusk implants, steroids, larynx alterations).
If discovered by an ork, reaction varies from hostility to acceptance (with hazing ritual). May face stigma from prejudiced humans/elves as 'race traitor'.

negative.name: Prejudiced
negative.summary: Outspoken bias against a group. Social penalties with that group.

effects.description: -2 dice per severity level (Biased -2, Outspoken -4, Radical -6) for Social Tests with the target group.
Target receives +2 per severity level (Biased +2, Outspoken +4, Radical +6) to their Negotiation Tests.

negative.name: Scorched
negative.summary: Neurological damage from Black IC, Psychotropic IC, or BTLs.

options.name: BTL
options.prerequisite: Mild Addiction to BTLs and BTL gear

options.name: Black IC
options.prerequisite: Must be a decker or technomancer

options.name: Psychotropic IC
options.prerequisite: Must be a decker or technomancer

effects.description: When entering VR or slotting a BTL, roll Body + Willpower (4). Failure triggers symptoms for 6 hours; glitch for 24 hours.
When facing the IC type that caused the Scorched condition, roll Willpower (3) to confront it without panicking.
-2 to Damage Resistance Tests when the triggering Black or Psychotropic IC inflicts damage.

negative.name: Sensitive System
negative.summary: Double Essence for cyberware. Bioware rejected. Awakened/technomancers: may increase Drain/Fading.

effects.description: Double the Essence cost of all cyberware implants.
Cannot have bioware implanted. The body rejects all bioware.
Awakened or technomancers must roll Willpower (2) before Drain/Fading tests. Failure increases Drain/Fading Value by +2 for that test.

negative.name: Simsense Vertigo
negative.summary: -2 to tests when using AR/VR/Simsense.

effects.description: –2 dice pool modifier to all tests while using augmented reality, virtual reality, or simsense.

negative.name: SINner
negative.summary: Legal SIN with tax obligations and tracking vulnerability.

1.name: National SIN
1.description: Citizen of a nation from birth. Biometrics in Global SIN Registry. Receives 3x spam. 15% tax.

2.name: Criminal SIN
2.description: Convicted felon. Must broadcast SIN. Shunned by society, denied entry to locations, questioned for local crimes. Awakened are registered. 15% tax.

3.name: Corporate Limited SIN
3.description: Hired into megacorp from outside. Can work as wageslave or low-level security. Valid extraction target. Distrusted by SINless. 20% tax.

4.name: Corporate Born SIN
4.description: Born into megacorp. Could have held leadership/officer positions. Records limited to issuing corp. Hated by SINless—discovery could be fatal. 10% tax.

effects.description: Tax percentage of gross income: National 15%, Criminal 15%, Corp Limited 20%, Corp Born 10%.
Biometric data in Global SIN Registry makes character easier to track if a job goes sideways.

negative.name: Social Stress
negative.summary: Emotional triggers reduce glitch threshold for social skills.

effects.description: When using Leadership or Etiquette skills, reduce the number of 1s required to glitch by 1.
GM may call for more Social Tests, particularly when situations related to the stress trigger arise.

negative.name: Spirit Bane
negative.summary: Specified spirits are hostile, harder to summon, resist banishment.

restrictions.note: Watchers and minions are constructs, not summoned spirits

effects.description: -2 dice pool modifier when attempting to summon or bind this spirit type.
Spirit receives +2 dice pool modifier when resisting the character's banishment attempts.
Spirits of this type harass the character and are reluctant to help them or their allies.
When ordered to attack a group containing this character, these spirits will single out and target the character first, using lethal force.

negative.name: Uncouth
negative.summary: –2 dice to resist social impulses; double Karma for Social skills.

restrictions.description: Characters cannot learn Social skill groups; they must purchase Social skills individually. If they do not possess an entire Social skill group, they are considered 'unaware' of that group for defaulting purposes, even if they possess individual skills.

effects.description: –2 dice pool modifier to tests to resist acting on a social impulse or instinct (e.g., resisting intimidation, seduction, or con attempts).
Must pay double Karma costs for all Social skills.
Cannot learn Social skill groups; must purchase individual Social skills only.

If the character does not possess an entire Social skill group, they are 'unaware' for defaulting purposes, suffering the -1 penalty for being untrained plus unable to default on group skills they don't own.

negative.name: Uneducated
negative.summary: Cannot default Technical/Academic skills; double Karma for Technical, Academic Knowledge, and Professional Knowledge skills.

restrictions.description: Characters cannot default on Technical, Academic Knowledge, or Professional Knowledge skills. They are considered 'unaware' of skill groups they don't fully possess in these categories.

effects.description: Must pay double Karma costs for all Technical skills.
Must pay double Karma costs for all Academic Knowledge skills.
Must pay double Karma costs for all Professional Knowledge skills.
Cannot default on Technical skills.
Cannot default on Academic Knowledge skills.
Cannot default on Professional Knowledge skills.
Cannot learn Technical skill groups; must purchase individual Technical skills only.
If the character does not possess an entire Technical skill group, they are 'unaware' for defaulting purposes.

negative.name: Unsteady Hands
negative.summary: -2 Agility tests when stressed/shaking; requires Body + Agility (4) test to avoid.

effects.description: When the character is in a stressful situation, they must make a Body + Agility (4) Test. Failure means shaky hands for the rest of the turn.
On failed test, suffer –2 dice pool modifier to all Agility-based tests requiring steady hands (shooting, melee combat, spellcasting, etc.) for the remainder of the Combat Turn.

stressTriggers: Any situation the GM deems stressful

negative.name: Weak Immune System
negative.summary: Diseases and toxins act with +2 effective Power against you.

effects.description: All diseases have +2 to their effective Power rating when resisted by this character.
All toxins have +2 to their effective Power rating when resisted by this character.

lifestyles.name: Street
lifestyles.description: Living on the streets with no permanent shelter.

lifestyles.name: Low
lifestyles.description: A small apartment in a rough neighborhood.

lifestyles.name: Middle
lifestyles.description: A comfortable apartment with basic amenities.

lifestyles.name: High
lifestyles.description: Upscale housing in a secure neighborhood.

lifestyles.name: Luxury
lifestyles.description: The finest accommodations money can buy.

lifestyleOptions.name: Special Work Area
lifestyleOptions.description: A workshop, garage, office, studio, or other specialized work space. Skill checks relevant to the setting have their Limit increased by 2 when performed in this space.
lifestyleOptions.effects: +2 Limit to relevant skill checks in this space

lifestyleOptions.name: Extra Secure
lifestyleOptions.description: Security is particularly tight - walls, vigilant contractors, patrols, or powerful neighbors. All High Threat Response and security response rolls are made at one level better than normal.

lifestyleOptions.name: Obscure/Difficult to Find
lifestyleOptions.description: Your place is particularly difficult to find or in an obscure area. Everyone needs directions or a good map. Any Sneaking tests (owner excluded) in the vicinity are made with a -2 penalty.
lifestyleOptions.effects: -2 penalty to Sneaking tests by visitors

lifestyleOptions.name: Cramped
lifestyleOptions.description: Just enough space to live, not much else. Forget hobbies or work. Any skill checks tied to Logic have their Limit reduced by 2 (minimum 1) in this space.

lifestyleOptions.name: Dangerous Area
lifestyleOptions.description: The area is prone to crime and violence. Security and law enforcement are overwhelmed and slow to respond. Any High Threat Response or security response rolls are made as if one level lower.

subscriptions.name: DocWagon Contract (Basic)
subscriptions.description: Medical response service covering Zones 1-2. Yearly cost: 5,000¥

subscriptions.name: DocWagon Contract (Gold)
subscriptions.description: Medical response service covering Zones 1-6. Yearly cost: 25,000¥

subscriptions.name: DocWagon Contract (Platinum)
subscriptions.description: Medical response service covering Zones 1-8. Yearly cost: 50,000¥

subscriptions.name: DocWagon Contract (Super-Platinum)
subscriptions.description: Medical response service covering Zones 1-8 with premium service. Yearly cost: 100,000¥

subscriptions.name: Food Service (Basic)
subscriptions.description: Basic meal delivery service. Cost: Rating × 200¥/month

bows.name: Bow
bows.description: Bows have a rating from 1-6. Damage is (Rating + 2)P, AP is -(Rating / 4 rounded down). A character needs minimum STR equal to the bow's rating to use it.

projectileAmmunition.name: Arrow
projectileAmmunition.description: Standard arrows for bows. Rating must match bow rating.

projectileAmmunition.name: Injection Arrow
projectileAmmunition.description: Hollow arrows designed to deliver drugs or toxins on impact.

projectileAmmunition.name: Injection Bolt
projectileAmmunition.description: Hollow bolts designed to deliver drugs or toxins on impact.

armor.name: Armor Clothing
armor.description: Fashionable clothing with hidden armor weave.

armor.name: Chameleon Suit
armor.description: Thermoptic camouflage suit with ruthenium coating.

armor.name: Electrochromic Modification
armor.description: Color-changing fabric that can display patterns, images, or blend with surroundings.

armor.name: Feedback Clothing
armor.description: Clothing with haptic feedback for simsense and VR experiences.

armor.name: Lined Coat
armor.description: Long armored coat popular with street samurai.

armor.name: Full Body Armor Chemical Seal
armor.description: Hermetically seals the suit against chemical and biological agents.

armor.name: Full Body Armor Environmental Adaptation
armor.description: Adapts the suit to extreme environmental conditions.

armorModifications.name: Chemical Protection
armorModifications.description: Provides protection against contact-vector chemical attacks.

armorModifications.name: Chemical Seal
armorModifications.description: Completely seals the armor against chemical and biological agents.

armorModifications.name: Fire Resistance
armorModifications.description: Provides protection against fire and heat damage.

armorModifications.name: Shock Frills
armorModifications.description: Delivers an electrical shock to anyone who touches the wearer.

armorModifications.name: Thermal Damping
armorModifications.description: Masks the wearer's thermal signature from thermographic vision.

commlinks.name: Sim Module
commlinks.description: Simsense module for commlinks. Allows BTL playback and AR/VR experience.

commlinks.name: Sim Module (Hot-Sim Modified)
commlinks.description: Hot-sim modified simsense module. Illegal due to lack of safety limiters.

cyberdecks.name: Fairlight Excalibur
cyberdecks.description: The legendary Excalibur - the best money can buy.

electronics.name: Area Jammer
electronics.description: Jams wireless signals in an area. Generates noise equal to its rating. Rating reduced by 1 per 5m from center.

electronics.name: Binoculars
electronics.description: Electronic binoculars with capacity for vision enhancements. Capacity equals rating.

electronics.name: Camera
electronics.description: Electronic camera with capacity for vision enhancements. Capacity equals rating.

electronics.name: Headjammer
electronics.description: Personal jammer worn as a headband. Generates noise equal to rating.

electronics.name: Micro-transceiver
electronics.description: Tiny radio transceiver for short-range communication.

electronics.name: Tag Eraser
electronics.description: Erases RFID tags within a few centimeters.

electronics.name: White Noise Generator
electronics.description: Generates white noise to defeat audio surveillance. Rating = noise generated.

electronics.name: Directional Jammer
electronics.description: Jams wireless signals in a cone (Rating 1-6).

electronics.name: Goggles
electronics.description: Electronic goggles with capacity for vision enhancements. Capacity equals rating.

electronics.name: Contacts
electronics.description: Contact lenses with capacity for vision enhancements. Capacity equals rating.

electronics.name: Glasses
electronics.description: Electronic glasses with capacity for vision enhancements. Capacity equals rating.

electronics.name: Endoscope
electronics.description: Flexible fiber-optic camera for looking around corners or into tight spaces.

electronics.name: Mage Sight Goggles
electronics.description: Goggles that allow non-Awakened users to see astral forms with an Assensing Test.

accessories.name: AR Gloves
accessories.description: Gloves for interacting with AR interfaces.

accessories.name: Trodes
accessories.description: External electrodes for simsense and AR without implants.

rfidTags.name: Datachip
rfidTags.description: Small data storage chips, sold per 10.

rfidTags.name: Sensor Tags
rfidTags.description: RFID tags with built-in sensors, sold per 10.

rfidTags.name: Stealth Tags
rfidTags.description: Hard to detect RFID tags, sold per 10.

visionEnhancements.name: Flare Compensation
visionEnhancements.description: Protects against sudden flashes of light and glare. Negates glare modifiers.

visionEnhancements.name: Image Link
visionEnhancements.description: Allows overlaying AR imagery on your vision.

visionEnhancements.name: Low-Light Vision
visionEnhancements.description: Amplifies existing light, allowing vision in dim conditions.

visionEnhancements.name: Smartlink
visionEnhancements.description: Provides targeting data from a smartgun, granting +2 accuracy.

visionEnhancements.name: Thermographic Vision
visionEnhancements.description: Allows seeing heat signatures, useful in darkness or through smoke.

visionEnhancements.name: Vision Enhancement
visionEnhancements.description: Improves visual acuity. Adds rating as dice to visual Perception tests.

visionEnhancements.name: Vision Magnification
visionEnhancements.description: Provides telescopic zoom capability for distant viewing.

tools.name: Chisel/Crowbar
tools.description: Doubles effective Strength when forcing a door or container.

tools.name: Miniwelder
tools.description: Portable welder with 30 minutes of operation. DV 25 against barriers.

tools.name: Monofilament Chainsaw
tools.description: Motorized saw with monofilament wire. DV 8P (doubled vs barriers), Acc 3, Reach 1, AP -6. Uses Exotic Melee Weapon skill.

housings.name: Handheld Housing
housings.description: Portable sensor housing. Capacity equals rating.

housings.name: Wall-Mounted Housing
housings.description: Fixed installation sensor housing. Capacity equals rating.

housings.name: Sensor Array
housings.description: Sensor package that includes up to 8 functions. Use Electronic Warfare in place of Perception, sensor Rating as limit.

housings.name: Single Sensor
housings.description: Single function sensor. Use Electronic Warfare in place of Perception, sensor Rating as limit.

functions.name: Cyberware Scanner
functions.description: Millimeter-wave scanner to detect cyber-implants and contraband.

functions.name: Laser Range Finder
functions.description: Calculates exact distance to target via laser reflection.

functions.name: MAD Scanner
functions.description: Magnetic Anomaly Detection - detects weapons and metal concentrations.

functions.name: Motion Sensor
functions.description: Ultrasound and infrared motion and temperature detection.

functions.name: Olfactory Sensor
functions.description: Analyzes airborne molecules like olfactory booster cyberware.

functions.name: Radio Signal Scanner
functions.description: Can be used as a bug scanner.

functions.name: Ultrasound
functions.description: Creates topographic map via ultrasonic pulses. Sees textures, distances, and invisible targets. Cannot see color, brightness, or through glass.

securityDevices.name: Maglock
securityDevices.description: Electronic lock with various access control options.

securityDevices.name: Anti-tamper Circuits
securityDevices.description: Adds security against tampering to maglock.

restraints.name: Metal Restraints
restraints.description: Standard metal handcuffs with mechanical or wireless lock.

restraints.name: Plasteel Restraints
restraints.description: Flash-fused restraints that must be cut free.

restraints.name: Plastic Restraints (10)
restraints.description: Disposable plastic zip-tie restraints, pack of 10.

restraints.name: Containment Manacles
restraints.description: Restricts movement to a shuffle, prevents cyber-implant weapon extension.

survival.name: Chemsuit
survival.description: Impermeable coverall worn over clothes or armor providing chemical protection equal to its Rating. Not vacuum sealed like a hazmat suit. If worn on top of chemical-resistant armor, only the highest chemical protection rating applies.

survival.name: Climbing Gear
survival.description: Backpack full of rope (400-kilo test), ascent/descent harness, gloves, carabiners, crampons, and other gear for assisted climbing.

survival.name: Rappelling Gloves
survival.description: Special fabric gloves providing +2 dice pool bonus on tests to hold grip on a grapple line. Required for using microwire safely.

survival.name: Flashlight
survival.description: Long-lasting, super bright flashlight. Available in low-light and infrared versions. Can be mounted to weapon's top or under-barrel mount.

survival.name: Diving Gear
survival.description: Diving suit, partial facemask with snorkel, breathing regulator, air tank with 2 hours of air, and inflatable vest. Regulator and tank protect against inhalation toxins. Wet suit provides Rating 1 resistance to Cold damage.

survival.name: Gecko Tape Gloves
survival.description: Dry adhesive gloves, kneepads, and slip-on-soles with millions of microscopic hairs that bond to surfaces. Allows assisted climbing. Useless when wet. Wireless: adhesive can be neutralized with wireless signal.
survival.wirelessBonus: Adhesive outer layer can be temporarily neutralized with a wireless signal, useful for getting on and off without sticking.

survival.name: Hazmat Suit
survival.description: Full body suit with internal air tank (4 hours). Provides chemical seal and protects from contact and inhalation vector toxins. Many include Geiger counter.
survival.wirelessBonus: Analyzes and transmits information about the environment you're not touching or breathing.

survival.name: Light Stick
survival.description: Bend, snap, and shake for three hours of soft chemical illumination covering a ten-meter radius.

survival.name: Magnesium Torch
survival.description: Strike and activate for five minutes of bright torchlight.

survival.name: Micro Flare Launcher
survival.description: Shoots colored flares 200 meters into the air, illuminating a city block for a couple minutes and negating poor/low lighting modifiers. Uses Exotic Ranged Weapon skill; deals 5P Fire damage if shot at someone.

survival.name: Micro Flares
survival.description: Ammunition for micro flare launcher.

survival.name: Grapple Gun
survival.description: Shoots a grappling hook and attached rope using Light Crossbow ranges. Includes internal winch to pull back the grapple or pull up small loads. Uses Exotic Ranged Weapon skill.

survival.name: Catalyst Stick
survival.description: Reusable stick that triggers a chemical reaction in stealth rope, crumbling it to dust within seconds and leaving almost no trace.

survival.name: Microwire (100m)
survival.description: Extremely thin (nearly monofilament) resilient fiber rope. Can only be grabbed with rappelling gloves; without them it inflicts 8P damage AP -8. Supports up to 100 kg.

survival.name: Myomeric Rope (10m)
survival.description: Made of special myomeric fiber, this rope's movement can be controlled remotely (max 30m). Can wind like a snake to reach around obstacles or tie to ledges. Moves at 2 meters per Combat Turn.

survival.name: Standard Rope (100m)
survival.description: Standard climbing rope supporting up to 400 kg.

survival.name: Stealth Rope (100m)
survival.description: Special rope that crumbles to dust when touched with a catalyst stick, leaving almost no trace. Supports up to 400 kg.

survival.name: Survival Kit
survival.description: Rugged bag containing knife, lighter, matches, compass, lightweight thermal blanket, several days' worth of ration bars, water-purification unit, and more. Good for a go-bag.

survival.name: Respirator
survival.description: Filter-mask worn over mouth and nose protecting against inhalation-vector toxins. Adds rating to toxin resistance tests against inhalation-vector toxins.

survival.name: Gas Mask
survival.description: Air-supplied re-breather covering your face, providing immunity to inhalation-vector toxin attacks. Includes one-hour clean-air supply (replacements 40¥). Can attach to larger air tanks. Cannot be combined with a respirator.
survival.wirelessBonus: Analyzes and gives information about the surrounding air that you're not breathing.

industrialChemicals.name: Glue Solvent
industrialChemicals.description: Spray can with enough solvent to dissolve about a square meter of fast-drying aerosol superglue.

industrialChemicals.name: Glue Sprayer
industrialChemicals.description: Fast-drying aerosol superglue for gluing two rigid surfaces together. Holds enough for about a square meter (an exterior door or picture window). Takes 1 Combat Turn to harden. Glue has Body and Strength 5 for forcing (Opposed Body + Strength Test).

industrialChemicals.name: Thermite Burning Bar
industrialChemicals.description: Thermite gel incendiary material on a rod with handle and frame used to melt holes in iron, steel, and plasteel. Inflicts Fire Damage DV 30P. Must be set carefully; cannot be used as a weapon unless target is tied up or unconscious.

medical.name: Biomonitor
medical.description: Compact device measuring life signs (heart rate, blood pressure, temperature, etc.) and analyzing blood, sweat, and skin samples. Worn as armband/wristband or integrated into clothing/commlinks.
medical.wirelessBonus: Shares information with designated wireless devices and can auto-alert DocWagon or other ambulance services if life signs reach certain thresholds.

medical.name: Disposable Syringe
medical.description: Plastic syringe with metal needle for single use. Can apply injection-vector toxins. Uncooperative victims may need to be immobilized or grappled first.

medical.name: Medkit
medical.description: Drug supplies, bandages, tools, and doctor expert system advising on medical emergencies. Rating 3 or lower fits in pocket; Rating 4+ is handheld case. Needs restocking after (Rating) uses. Add rating to limit on First Aid tests.
medical.wirelessBonus: Provides dice pool bonus equal to rating to First Aid + Logic tests, or can operate itself with dice pool of Rating x 2 and limit equal to Rating.

medical.name: Medkit Supplies
medical.description: Replacement supplies for medkit after use.

security.name: Anti-Tamper Circuits
security.description: Maglock add-on that triggers alarms if tampered with (Rating 1-4).

miscellaneous.name: Fake SIN
miscellaneous.description: Forged System Identification Number. Quality depends on rating.

miscellaneous.name: Fake License
miscellaneous.description: Forged permit or license tied to a SIN. Quality depends on rating.

miscellaneous.name: Ear Buds
miscellaneous.description: Small audio device fitting into the ear.

ammunition.name: Flechette Ammo (100)
ammunition.description: Flechette rounds (+2 DV vs unarmored, +5 AP).

weaponMods.name: Airburst Link
weaponMods.description: Reduces scatter distance for launched grenades by 2m per net hit instead of 1m.

weaponMods.name: Bipod
weaponMods.description: Provides 2 points of Recoil Compensation when properly deployed.

weaponMods.name: Concealable Holster
weaponMods.description: Adds -1 to the item's Concealability. Only fits pistols and tasers.

weaponMods.name: Gas-Vent System
weaponMods.description: Provides Recoil Compensation equal to its rating. Cannot be removed once installed.

weaponMods.name: Gyro Mount
weaponMods.description: Heavy upper-body harness with motorized gyro-stabilized arm. Neutralizes up to 6 points of recoil and movement modifiers.

weaponMods.name: Hidden Arm Slide
weaponMods.description: Forearm slide for quick-drawing small weapons. Threshold for quick draw is 2.

weaponMods.name: Imaging Scope
weaponMods.description: Classic scope with micro camera and vision magnification. Has Capacity 3 for vision enhancements.

weaponMods.name: Laser Sight
weaponMods.description: Projects a visible dot on target. Increases Accuracy by 1 (not cumulative with smartlink).

weaponMods.name: Periscope
weaponMods.description: Allows targeting around corners with -2 dice pool penalty instead of -3.

weaponMods.name: Quick-Draw Holster
weaponMods.description: Reduces the threshold for quick-drawing by 1. Fits machine pistol or smaller.

weaponMods.name: Shock Pad
weaponMods.description: Shock-absorbing pad for rifles, shotguns, or heavy weapons. Provides 1 point of recoil compensation.

weaponMods.name: Silencer/Suppressor
weaponMods.description: Reduces sound and flash of weapon discharge. -4 dice pool modifier on Perception Tests to notice or locate firer. Cannot be used with revolvers or shotguns.

weaponMods.name: Smart Firing Platform
weaponMods.description: Non-mobile robotic tripod with Pilot 3 and Targeting autosoft 3. Provides 5 points of Recoil Compensation.

weaponMods.name: Smartgun System, Internal
weaponMods.description: Internal smartgun system. Increases Accuracy by 2 when used with smartlink.

weaponMods.name: Smartgun System, External
weaponMods.description: External smartgun system. Increases Accuracy by 2 when used with smartlink.

weaponMods.name: Spare Clip
weaponMods.description: A spare clip that holds the maximum rounds for the weapon.

weaponMods.name: Speed Loader
weaponMods.description: Allows fully reloading a revolver as a Complex Action instead of one round at a time.

weaponMods.name: Tripod
weaponMods.description: Provides stable base for firing. 6 points of Recoil Compensation when deployed.

armorMods.name: Chemical Protection
armorMods.description: Adds rating to tests to resist contact-vector toxin attacks.

armorMods.name: Chemical Seal
armorMods.description: Airtight environmental control providing complete protection against contact and inhalation vector chemicals. Requires full body armor with helmet.

armorMods.name: Fire Resistance
armorMods.description: Adds rating to Armor value when resisting Fire attacks or checking if armor catches fire.

armorMods.name: Insulation
armorMods.description: Adds rating to Armor value when resisting Cold attacks.

armorMods.name: Nonconductivity
armorMods.description: Adds rating to Armor value when resisting Electricity attacks.

armorMods.name: Shock Frills
armorMods.description: Electrically charged strips that inflict Electricity damage to anyone touching you. 10 charges, recharges 1 per 10 seconds when plugged in.

armorMods.name: Thermal Damping
armorMods.description: Reduces thermal signature. Adds rating to limit on Sneaking tests against thermographic vision or thermal sensors.

gearMods.name: Audio Enhancement
gearMods.description: Provides efficient noise filtering and audio enhancement.
gearMods.wirelessBonus: +Dice Pool bonus to Audio Perception equal to rating.

gearMods.name: Select Sound Filter
gearMods.description: Allows user to selectively filter specific sounds.
gearMods.wirelessBonus: +Dice Pool bonus to Audio Perception vs specific sound equal to rating.

vehicleMods.name: Rigger Interface
vehicleMods.description: When added to a vehicle, this lets you use a control rig to jump in and control it directly through immersive virtual reality. Allows control via direct fiber-optic cable or wireless link.

vehicleMods.name: Standard Weapon Mount
vehicleMods.description: Standard weapon mounts may hold any assault rifle or smaller-sized weapon and 250 rounds of ammo. Operated remotely with ninety-degree arc of fire.

vehicleMods.name: Heavy Weapon Mount
vehicleMods.description: Heavy weapon mounts count as two weapon mounts and can hold any weapon and up to 500 rounds of belted ammo or up to Body rockets/missiles. Operated remotely with ninety-degree arc of fire.

vehicleMods.name: Manual Operation
vehicleMods.description: Manual operation can be added to weapon mounts, but only for vehicles, not drones.

vehicleModRules.description: Vehicles may be equipped with a number of weapon mounts equal to their unaugmented Body ÷ 3 (round down).

catalog.name: Control Rig
catalog.description: VCR for controlling vehicles and drones. Adds rating to vehicle test limits when jumped in.
catalog.wirelessBonus: Noise reduction equal to rating when jumped into a vehicle or drone.

catalog.name: Cybereyes
catalog.description: Replacement eyes with 4 capacity for upgrades.
catalog.wirelessBonus: When wirelessly enabled, gives +1 limit to Perception tests.

catalog.name: Cyberears
catalog.description: Replacement ears with 4 capacity.

catalog.name: Dermal Plating
catalog.description: Bonus Armor equal to Rating (cumulative with worn armor, no Encumbrance). Cannot be combined with orthoskin or other skin augmentations that provide armor.

catalog.name: Internal Air Tank
catalog.description: 1 hour of internal oxygen supply.

catalog.name: Muscle Replacement
catalog.description: +Rating STR and AGI. Cannot be combined with muscle augmentation or muscle toner bioware.

catalog.name: Reaction Enhancers
catalog.description: +Rating REA (adjust Initiative and Physical limit accordingly). Incompatible with wired reflexes and other Reaction enhancements.
catalog.wirelessBonus: Compatible with wireless wired reflexes; total Reaction bonus from both can exceed +4 if both have wireless active.

catalog.name: Wired Reflexes
catalog.description: +1 REA, +1D6 Initiative.

catalog.name: Datajack
catalog.description: Standard neural interface for DNI. Allows connection to electronic devices.
catalog.wirelessBonus: Can switch between devices and maintain multiple connections without physical contact. Rating 1 noise reduction.

catalog.name: Commlink (Implanted)
catalog.description: Implanted commlink with subvocal microphone.

catalog.name: Cortex Bomb (Kink)
catalog.description: Cranial explosive for security/control. Kink model causes disabling pain.

catalog.name: Cortex Bomb (Micro)
catalog.description: Smaller cranial explosive. 3P damage, -3 AP.

catalog.name: Cortex Bomb (Area)
catalog.description: Cranial explosive with area effect. 15P, -6 AP, -1/m.

catalog.name: Olfactory Booster
catalog.description: Enhanced sense of smell. +Rating to smell-based Perception tests.

catalog.name: Taste Booster
catalog.description: Enhanced taste sensitivity. +Rating to taste analysis tests.

catalog.name: Tooth Compartment
catalog.description: Hollow tooth for concealing small items.

catalog.name: Ultrasound Sensor
catalog.description: Sonar imaging system. Can 'see' in complete darkness.

catalog.name: Voice Modulator
catalog.description: Modify vocal patterns. +Rating to vocal impersonation.

catalog.name: Skilljack
catalog.description: Interprets knowsofts and linguasofts. Can run activesofts with skillwires.
catalog.wirelessBonus: Increases total skill rating limit to Rating x 3.

catalog.name: Simrig
catalog.description: Records sensory data for simsense playback or sale.

catalog.name: Data Lock
catalog.description: Turns bearer into a walking data safe. Device Rating equal to implant rating.

catalog.name: Cyberdeck (Implanted)
catalog.description: Implanted cyberdeck. Cost is in addition to the deck itself.

catalog.name: Flare Compensation
catalog.description: Negates glare and flash modifiers.

catalog.name: Image Link
catalog.description: AR display capability.

catalog.name: Low-Light Vision
catalog.description: See in low-light conditions as if fully lit.

catalog.name: Smartlink
catalog.description: +2 accuracy with smartgun systems. Implanted version is more effective than external.

catalog.name: Thermographic Vision
catalog.description: Infrared vision to see heat signatures.

catalog.name: Vision Enhancement
catalog.description: +Rating to visual Perception tests.

catalog.name: Vision Magnification
catalog.description: Electronic magnification up to 50x.

catalog.name: Ocular Drone
catalog.description: Spyball drone placed in ocular cavity. Functions as normal cybereye with all enhancements until removed and controlled as Horizon Flying Eye. -3 dice pool to all tasks when removed. If both eyes are drones, you are blind while they operate apart from you.

catalog.name: Retinal Duplication
catalog.description: Copy a target's retinal pattern.

catalog.name: Audio Enhancement
catalog.description: +Rating to audio Perception tests.

catalog.name: Balance Augmenter
catalog.description: +1 dice to tests involving balance (climbing, narrow platforms, landing after jumps).

catalog.name: Damper
catalog.description: Protection from loud noises. +2 dice pool to resist sonic attacks including flashbangs.

catalog.name: Select Sound Filter
catalog.description: Filter specific sounds from environment. Max Rating 6 (vs Rating 3 for external version).

catalog.name: Spatial Recognizer
catalog.description: +2 dice to locate sounds.

catalog.name: Bone Lacing (Plastic)
catalog.description: +1 Body for damage resistance. Unarmed DV +1.

catalog.name: Bone Lacing (Aluminum)
catalog.description: +2 Body for damage resistance. Unarmed DV +2.

catalog.name: Bone Lacing (Titanium)
catalog.description: +3 Body for damage resistance. Unarmed DV +3.

catalog.name: Fingertip Compartment
catalog.description: Small concealed compartment in fingertip.

catalog.name: Grapple Gun (Implant)
catalog.description: Implanted grapple launcher.

catalog.name: Skillwires
catalog.description: Use activesofts up to rating (requires skilljack). Incompatible with reflex recorder bioware.
catalog.wirelessBonus: +1 to relevant inherent Limit (Physical, Mental, or Social) for skills used through skillwires.

catalog.name: Smuggling Compartment
catalog.description: Shielded compartment for smuggling items.

catalog.name: Obvious Cyberarm
catalog.description: Full cybernetic arm. Base stats: AGI 3, STR 3.

catalog.name: Synthetic Cyberarm
catalog.description: Realistic-looking cyberarm. Base stats: AGI 3, STR 3.

catalog.name: Obvious Cyberleg
catalog.description: Full cybernetic leg. Base stats: AGI 3, STR 3.

catalog.name: Synthetic Cyberleg
catalog.description: Realistic-looking cyberleg. Base stats: AGI 3, STR 3.

catalog.name: Obvious Cybertorso
catalog.description: Cybernetic torso shell. Does not replace organs.

catalog.name: Obvious Cyberskull
catalog.description: Cybernetic skull shell. Does not replace brain.

catalog.name: Obvious Cyberhand
catalog.description: Replacement hand. Base stats: AGI 3, STR 3. Attributes only apply to tests directly involving the hand.

catalog.name: Obvious Cyberfoot
catalog.description: Replacement foot. Base stats: AGI 3, STR 3. Attributes only apply to tests directly involving the foot.

catalog.name: Obvious Lower Cyberarm
catalog.description: Forearm replacement (includes hand). Base stats: AGI 3, STR 3.

catalog.name: Obvious Lower Cyberleg
catalog.description: Lower leg replacement (includes foot). Base stats: AGI 3, STR 3.

catalog.name: Cyberlimb Agility Enhancement
catalog.description: +Rating to limb AGI (max +3 over base). One enhancement per type per limb.

catalog.name: Cyberlimb Strength Enhancement
catalog.description: +Rating to limb STR (max +3 over base). One enhancement per type per limb.

catalog.name: Cyberlimb Armor Enhancement
catalog.description: +Rating armor bonus, cumulative with worn armor, no encumbrance. One enhancement per type per limb.

catalog.name: Cyberarm Gyromount
catalog.description: Arm-mounted weapon stabilization system. Rating 3 recoil compensation. Activating or deactivating is a Simple Action.
catalog.wirelessBonus: Activating or deactivating the system is a Free Action.

catalog.name: Cyber Holster
catalog.description: Concealed holster for taser or pistol-sized weapons. Inserting or retrieving a weapon takes one Simple Action. Can also be used as a smuggling compartment.
catalog.wirelessBonus: Readying a weapon from the holster is a Free Action.

catalog.name: Cyberarm Slide
catalog.description: Integral hidden arm-slide for hold-out, taser, or light pistol. Ready weapon as a Free Action.

catalog.name: Hydraulic Jacks
catalog.description: Requires identical Rating in both cyberlegs. Each Rating adds +1 to Physical limit for jumping/sprinting, +20% to jump distance, and reduces falling distance by 2m for damage calculation.
catalog.wirelessBonus: +1 dice pool bonus to jumping, sprinting, or lifting tests with legs.

catalog.name: Large Smuggling Compartment
catalog.description: Larger shielded compartment for smuggling. Can hold a heavy pistol or small SMG. Getting something out or putting something in takes a Complex Action.
catalog.wirelessBonus: Getting something out or putting something in takes a Simple Action.

catalog.name: Synthetic Cyberhand
catalog.description: Realistic-looking replacement hand. Base stats: AGI 3, STR 3. Attributes only apply to tests directly involving the hand.

catalog.name: Synthetic Cyberfoot
catalog.description: Realistic-looking replacement foot. Base stats: AGI 3, STR 3. Attributes only apply to tests directly involving the foot.

catalog.name: Synthetic Lower Cyberarm
catalog.description: Realistic-looking forearm replacement (includes hand). Base stats: AGI 3, STR 3.

catalog.name: Synthetic Lower Cyberleg
catalog.description: Realistic-looking lower leg replacement (includes foot). Base stats: AGI 3, STR 3.

catalog.name: Synthetic Cybertorso
catalog.description: Realistic-looking cybernetic torso shell. Does not replace organs.

catalog.name: Synthetic Cyberskull
catalog.description: Realistic-looking cybernetic skull shell. Does not replace brain.

catalog.name: Hand Blade
catalog.description: Retractable blade in forearm. Reach 0, DV (STR+2)P, AP -2. Uses Unarmed Combat skill.

catalog.name: Hand Razors
catalog.description: Retractable finger blades. Reach 0, DV (STR+1)P, AP -3. Uses Unarmed Combat skill.

catalog.name: Spur
catalog.description: Wrist-mounted retractable blade. Reach 0, DV (STR+3)P, AP -2. Uses Unarmed Combat skill.

catalog.name: Shock Hand
catalog.description: Electrified hand. DV 8S(e), AP -5.

catalog.name: Implant Weapon (Hold-Out Pistol)
catalog.description: Concealed hold-out pistol with internal magazine. Pre-equipped with smartgun system.

catalog.name: Implant Weapon (Light Pistol)
catalog.description: Concealed light pistol with internal magazine. Pre-equipped with smartgun system.

catalog.name: Implant Weapon (Machine Pistol)
catalog.description: Concealed machine pistol. Cost is in addition to the weapon itself.

catalog.name: Implant Weapon (Heavy Pistol)
catalog.description: Concealed heavy pistol with internal magazine. Pre-equipped with smartgun system.

catalog.name: Implant Weapon (Submachine Gun)
catalog.description: Concealed submachine gun with internal magazine. Pre-equipped with smartgun system.

catalog.name: Implant Weapon (Shotgun)
catalog.description: Concealed shotgun with internal magazine. Pre-equipped with smartgun system.

catalog.name: Implant Weapon (Grenade Launcher)
catalog.description: Concealed grenade launcher. Pre-equipped with smartgun system.

catalog.name: External Clip Port
catalog.description: External ammunition port for implant weapons.

catalog.name: Laser Sight (Implant)
catalog.description: Integrated laser sight for implant weapons.

catalog.name: Silencer/Suppressor (Implant)
catalog.description: Integrated silencer for implant weapons.

catalog.name: Cyber Holster
catalog.description: Concealed weapon compartment.

catalog.name: Adrenaline Pump
catalog.description: +1 BOD, AGI, REA, STR when activated. Costs Edge.

catalog.name: Muscle Augmentation
catalog.description: +1 STR.

catalog.name: Muscle Toner
catalog.description: +1 AGI.

catalog.name: Pathogenic Defense
catalog.description: +1 dice vs. pathogens and disease.

catalog.name: Symbiotes
catalog.description: Enhanced healing. Heal +1 box/day.

catalog.name: Tracheal Filter
catalog.description: +1 dice vs. inhaled toxins.

catalog.name: Tailored Pheromones
catalog.description: +1 to Acting and Influence skill tests. +1 Social Limit.

catalog.name: Bone Density Augmentation
catalog.description: Unarmed damage becomes (STR)P. Incompatible with bone lacing.

catalog.name: Toxin Extractor
catalog.description: +1 dice to Toxin Resistance tests.

catalog.name: Cerebral Booster
catalog.description: +1 LOG.

catalog.name: Damage Compensators
catalog.description: Ignore 1 wound modifier.

catalog.name: Mnemonic Enhancer
catalog.description: +1 to memory tests. +1 to Knowledge skill maximums.

catalog.name: Synaptic Booster
catalog.description: Broadened and replicated spinal nerve cells allow faster reaction time. Provides +1 Reaction and +1D6 Initiative per rating. Cannot be combined with any other Reaction or Initiative enhancement.

catalog.name: Cat's Eyes
catalog.description: Low-Light Vision. Note: Incompatible with cybereyes.

catalog.name: Enhanced Articulation
catalog.description: +1 to Escape Artist tests and Physical Limit.

catalog.name: Orthoskin
catalog.description: Bonus Armor equal to Rating (compatible with bone lacing). Cannot be combined with dermal plating or other skin augmentations that provide armor.

catalog.name: Platelet Factories
catalog.description: +1 die to resist bleeding. Reduces Overflow threshold penalty.

catalog.name: Reflex Recorder
catalog.description: Adds +1 to rating of a specific skill linked to a Physical attribute. Multiple recorders may be taken for different skills, but not for the same skill.

catalog.name: Skin Pocket
catalog.description: Concealed pocket in skin for small items.

catalog.name: Suprathyroid Gland
catalog.description: +1 to all physical attributes (BOD, AGI, REA, STR).

catalog.name: Synthacardium
catalog.description: +Rating dice to Cardiovascular tests (fatigue, holding breath, etc.).

catalog.name: Pain Editor
catalog.description: Ignore all wound modifiers. Requires Willpower (3) to activate.

catalog.name: Sleep Regulator
catalog.description: Only need 3 hours of sleep per day.

categories.name: VTOL/LAV
categories.description: Vertical takeoff aircraft and low-altitude vehicles

drones.name: Lockheed Optic-X2
drones.description: Advanced surveillance drone with stealth features

drones.name: MCT-Nissan Roto-Drone
drones.description: Popular aerial drone with weapon mount

drones.name: Ares Duelist
drones.description: Anthroform combat drone with sword arms

drones.name: Cyberspace Designs Dalmatian
drones.description: Large utility drone with cargo capacity

drones.name: Ares Steel Lynx Combat Drone
drones.description: Heavy combat drone with turret-mounted weaponry

rccs.name: Scratch-Built Junk
rccs.description: Homemade RCC cobbled together from spare parts.

rccs.name: Maersk Spider
rccs.description: Balanced mid-range RCC with strong firewall.

rccs.name: MCT Drone Web
rccs.description: High-end MCT RCC for serious riggers.

rccs.name: Triox UberMensch
rccs.description: The ultimate RCC - top of the line in every way.

autosofts.name: Maneuvering
autosofts.description: Piloting tests for specific vehicle type

autosofts.name: Targeting
autosofts.description: Attack tests with specific weapon type

creationMethods.name: Priority System
creationMethods.description: Assign priorities A-E to Metatype, Attributes, Magic/Resonance, Skills, and Resources. Each priority used exactly once.

steps.title: Spells
steps.description: Select spells if you are a magician or mystic adept.

steps.title: Rituals
steps.description: Learn ritual spellcasting if your magical path includes it.

steps.title: Adept Powers
steps.description: Select adept powers using your Power Points (equal to Magic for Adepts).

steps.title: Build Contacts
steps.description: Build your network of contacts using free Karma based on Charisma.

steps.title: Augmentations
steps.description: Install cyberware and bioware. Essence loss affects Magic rating.

steps.title: Matrix Programs
steps.description: Select Matrix programs for your cyberdeck

steps.title: Spend Karma
steps.description: Spend remaining Karma on spells, complex forms, or stat improvements. Max 7 Karma carryover.

steps.title: Identities & SINs
steps.description: Create identities with SINs (fake or real) and licenses. Each character must have at least one identity.

budgets.label: Contact Karma
budgets.description: Free Karma for contacts = CHA x 3

constraints.description: Each priority level (A-E) must be used exactly once.
constraints.errorMessage: Each priority can only be assigned to one category.

constraints.description: Only one attribute can be at natural maximum at creation.
constraints.errorMessage: Only one attribute can be at its natural maximum.
Cannot spend more than 25 Karma on positive qualities.
Cannot gain more than 25 Karma from negative qualities.

constraints.description: Skills capped at 6 at creation (7 with Aptitude).
constraints.errorMessage: Skill rating cannot exceed 6 at creation (7 with Aptitude).

constraints.description: Edge starts at metatype value. Magic/Resonance start at priority value (0 for mundane).
constraints.errorMessage: Special attributes must meet minimum requirements.

constraints.description: Gear availability cannot exceed 12 at creation.
constraints.errorMessage: Cannot purchase gear with availability higher than 12.

common.name: Browse
common.description: This handy browser and search engine cuts the time for a Matrix Search action in half.
common.effects: Cuts Matrix Search time in half

common.name: Configurator
common.description: Stores an alternate configuration for your deck. When you reconfigure, you may switch to the stored configuration instead of just swapping two attributes.
common.effects: Store and recall a full deck configuration

common.name: Edit
common.description: Makes editing easier with a smart interface that learns your style and gives suggestions.
common.effects: +2 to Data Processing limit for Edit tests

common.name: Encryption
common.description: Activating the Encryption utility gives you a bonus to your Firewall attribute.

common.name: Signal Scrub
common.description: By analyzing background noise and incoming signals, Signal Scrub provides noise reduction.

common.name: Toolbox
common.description: Memory management utilities that improve your deck's processing power.

common.name: Virtual Machine
common.description: Creates a virtual memory space in your deck, giving increased program capacity at the cost of system stability.
common.effects: Run 2 additional programs, but take 1 additional unresistable box of Matrix damage when hit

hacking.name: Armor
hacking.description: Works with your firmware as a second firewall, giving you protection against Matrix damage.
hacking.effects: +2 dice pool modifier to resist Matrix damage

hacking.name: Baby Monitor
hacking.description: Uses algorithms stolen from GOD to keep track of your movements in the Matrix.
hacking.effects: Always know your current Overwatch Score

hacking.name: Biofeedback
hacking.description: Laces your attacks with dangerous biofeedback signals. Only works on biological targets.
hacking.effects: Matrix damage also deals equal Stun (cold-sim) or Physical (hot-sim) biofeedback damage. Resisted with Willpower + Firewall

hacking.name: Biofeedback Filter
hacking.description: A firewall for your sim module that protects against biofeedback attacks.
hacking.effects: +2 dice pool modifier to resist biofeedback damage

hacking.name: Blackout
hacking.description: A kinder version of Biofeedback that only causes Stun damage, even in hot-sim.
hacking.effects: Matrix damage also deals equal Stun biofeedback damage (regardless of sim mode)

hacking.name: Decryption
hacking.description: Code-cutting algorithms that help you break through encryption.

hacking.name: Defuse
hacking.description: Creates predictive barriers between you and Data Bombs.
hacking.effects: +4 dice pool modifier to resist Data Bomb damage

hacking.name: Demolition
hacking.description: Contains the latest and most effective Data Bomb-coding techniques.
hacking.effects: +1 to rating of Data Bombs you set

hacking.name: Exploit
hacking.description: Analyzes and scans a target for weaknesses in its Firewall.
hacking.effects: +2 Sleaze attribute when attempting Hack on the Fly

hacking.name: Fork
hacking.description: Perform a single Matrix action on two targets. Make one test with modifiers from both targets; each defends separately.
hacking.effects: Single Matrix action affects two targets

hacking.name: Guard
hacking.description: Keeps an eye out for weaknesses the same way an attacker would.
hacking.effects: Reduce extra damage from marks by 1 DV per mark

hacking.name: Hammer
hacking.description: Offensive program that increases the damage of your Matrix attacks.
hacking.effects: +2 DV Matrix damage when you cause damage with an action

hacking.name: Lockdown
hacking.description: When you damage a persona, they become link-locked until you stop running this program or they successfully Jack Out.

hacking.name: Mugger
hacking.description: Actively tracks your marks to increase bonus damage from them.

hacking.name: Shell
hacking.description: Filtering algorithms that protect against both Matrix and biofeedback damage. Stacks with similar modifiers.
hacking.effects: +1 dice pool modifier to resist Matrix and biofeedback damage

hacking.name: Sneak
hacking.description: Bounces your Matrix traffic through unnecessary routes to avoid tracking.
hacking.effects: +2 dice pool modifier to defend against Trace User. If demiGOD converges, they don't get your physical location

hacking.name: Stealth
hacking.description: A clever program that helps you stay hidden in the Matrix.

hacking.name: Track
hacking.description: Keeps an eye on your targets, making it easier to find their meat world equivalents.
hacking.effects: +2 Data Processing for Trace User tests, OR negates Sneak's +2 bonus (one benefit, not both)

hacking.name: Wrapper
hacking.description: Overrides Matrix protocols for icons. Your icons can appear as anything when using Change Icon action.
hacking.effects: Disguise icons as anything; requires Matrix Perception to see through

agents.name: Agent
agents.description: An autonomous program that can perform Matrix actions on your behalf. Uses its rating for all Matrix attributes.

datasofts.name: Datasoft
datasofts.description: Contains reference information on a single subject.

mapsofts.name: Mapsoft
mapsofts.description: Contains detailed maps of a specific area.

shopsofts.name: Shopsoft
shopsofts.description: Contains shopping catalogs and price comparisons.

tutorsofts.name: Tutorsoft
tutorsofts.description: Interactive instruction program. Rating determines quality of instruction.

skillsofts.name: Activesoft
skillsofts.description: Provides active skill knowledge. Requires skillwires to use.

skillsofts.name: Knowsoft
skillsofts.description: Provides knowledge skill information. Can be accessed without skillwires.

skillsofts.name: Linguasoft
skillsofts.description: Provides language translation. Can be accessed without skillwires.

foci.name: Weapon Focus
foci.description: A weapon that has been enchanted to serve as a focus. Adds its Force rating to the wielder's Magic attribute for the purposes of weapon skill tests. The bonding cost is (3 + weapon's Reach) × Force in Karma.

foci.name: Power Focus
foci.description: Increases the wielder's Magic attribute by its Force rating. This is the most powerful and expensive type of focus.

foci.name: Spell Focus
foci.description: Adds its Force rating as a dice pool modifier to Spellcasting tests for a specific spell. Must be bonded to a single spell.

foci.name: Spirit Focus
foci.description: Adds its Force rating as a dice pool modifier to Summoning tests for a specific spirit type.

foci.name: Enchanting Focus
foci.description: Adds its Force rating as a dice pool modifier to Enchanting tests.

foci.name: Metamagic Focus
foci.description: Adds its Force rating as a dice pool modifier when using specific metamagic techniques.

foci.name: Qi Focus
foci.description: Adds its Force rating as a dice pool modifier to specific Adept Power tests. Only usable by adepts.

archetypes.name: Fixer
archetypes.description: A shadow broker who connects runners with jobs, gear, and information. The essential contact for any runner.

archetypes.name: Street Doc
archetypes.description: An underground medical professional who provides healing, augmentation, and asks no questions.

archetypes.name: Talismonger
archetypes.description: A dealer in magical supplies, foci, reagents, and enchanted goods.

archetypes.name: Mr. Johnson
archetypes.description: A corporate agent who hires runners for deniable operations. High-paying but demanding.

archetypes.name: Gang Leader
archetypes.description: A street gang boss who provides muscle, territory access, and street-level intelligence.

archetypes.name: Fence
archetypes.description: A specialist in buying and selling stolen goods, no questions asked.

archetypes.name: Armorer
archetypes.description: A weapons dealer and modifier who can supply or customize combat gear.

archetypes.name: ID Manufacturer
archetypes.description: A forger who creates fake SINs, licenses, and identity documents.

archetypes.name: Bartender
archetypes.description: A social hub who hears everything and knows everyone in their neighborhood.

archetypes.name: Corporate Contact
archetypes.description: An insider at a megacorporation who provides access and information.

archetypes.name: Law Enforcement
archetypes.description: A cop or security officer who provides warnings, favors, and information.

archetypes.name: Media Contact
archetypes.description: A journalist or media personality who can spread or suppress stories.

archetypes.name: Academic
archetypes.description: A professor or researcher who provides analysis, translation, and obscure knowledge.

archetypes.name: Decker
archetypes.description: A matrix specialist who provides hacking services and digital intelligence.

archetypes.name: Rigger
archetypes.description: A vehicle specialist who provides transportation, drones, and mechanical expertise.

services.name: Basic Information
services.description: General information about a topic, person, or place that the contact might know.

services.name: Detailed Information
services.description: Specific, detailed information requiring research or insider knowledge.

services.name: Restricted Information
services.description: Classified or dangerous information that could put the contact at risk.

services.name: Casual Introduction
services.description: An introduction to someone in the contact's network, no strings attached.

services.name: Vouched Introduction
services.description: An introduction with the contact vouching for you, putting their reputation on the line.

services.name: Common Equipment
services.description: Procurement of commonly available gear at fair prices.

services.name: Restricted Equipment
services.description: Procurement of restricted or hard-to-find gear.

services.name: Forbidden Equipment
services.description: Procurement of illegal or military-grade gear.

services.name: Safe House
services.description: Temporary shelter in a secure location.

services.name: Basic Medical Care
services.description: First aid and stabilization of injuries.

services.name: Surgery
services.description: Surgical treatment of serious injuries or augmentation installation.

services.name: Cover Story Support
services.description: The contact vouches for your cover identity if questioned.

services.name: Transportation
services.description: Transportation to a destination, discretion guaranteed.

services.name: Smuggling
services.description: Transportation of goods or people across borders or checkpoints.

services.name: Muscle for Hire
services.description: Temporary muscle for protection or intimidation.

services.name: Fake SIN
services.description: Creation or renewal of a fake System Identification Number.

resultModifiers.description: Request has no impact on target

loyaltyEffects.description: Contact will only help for pay, may betray you
Contact will help for reasonable compensation
Contact will take risks for you
Contact will put themselves in danger for you

combat.name: Fire Weapon (SS)
combat.description: Fire a weapon in Single-Shot mode. One shot, one Simple Action.

prerequisites.description: Must have a readied ranged weapon

effects.description: Deal weapon damage plus net hits

combat.name: Fire Weapon (SA)
combat.description: Fire a weapon in Semi-Automatic mode. Fire up to 2 shots with recoil penalty.

prerequisites.description: Must have a readied ranged weapon

effects.description: Deal weapon damage plus net hits

combat.name: Fire Weapon (BF)
combat.description: Fire a weapon in Burst Fire mode. Fire 3 rounds, add +2 to attack, defender gets -2 to defense.

prerequisites.description: Must have a readied ranged weapon

effects.description: Deal weapon damage plus net hits

combat.name: Fire Weapon (FA)
combat.description: Fire a weapon in Full-Auto mode. Fire 6-10 rounds, complex action with significant bonuses.

prerequisites.description: Must have a readied ranged weapon

effects.description: Deal weapon damage plus net hits

combat.name: Melee Attack
combat.description: Attack a target in melee combat with a weapon or unarmed strike.

prerequisites.description: Target must be within melee range

modifiers.description: Weapon reach modifier vs opponent's reach

effects.description: Deal weapon damage (or STR for unarmed) plus net hits

combat.name: Throw Weapon
combat.description: Throw a melee weapon or throwing weapon at a target.

prerequisites.description: Must have a throwing weapon ready

effects.description: Deal weapon damage plus STR and net hits

combat.name: Ready/Draw Weapon
combat.description: Draw a weapon from a holster, sheath, or storage, making it ready to use.

prerequisites.description: Must have a weapon to ready

effects.description: Weapon becomes readied

combat.name: Take Aim
combat.description: Take aim at a target for +1 dice to your next attack (max +3, or Willpower with scope).

prerequisites.description: Must have a readied ranged weapon

effects.description: +1 dice to next attack (max +3, or Willpower with scope)

combat.name: Take Cover
combat.description: Move to available cover, gaining defense bonuses against ranged attacks.

effects.description: +2 to +4 defense against ranged attacks depending on cover quality

combat.name: Insert Clip
combat.description: Insert a fresh clip or magazine into a weapon.

prerequisites.description: Must have a readied ranged weapon

effects.description: Weapon is reloaded with fresh ammunition

combat.name: Remove Clip
combat.description: Remove the current clip or magazine from a weapon.

prerequisites.description: Must have a readied ranged weapon

effects.description: Clip is removed from weapon

combat.name: Quick Draw
combat.description: Attempt to draw a weapon and attack in one fluid motion. Opposed by opponent's reaction.

effects.description: Weapon is drawn and an attack can be made immediately

combat.name: Observe in Detail
combat.description: Make a Perception test to notice specific details about your surroundings.

effects.description: Gain detailed information based on hits

combat.name: Sprint
combat.description: Run at full speed, adding Sprinting hits to your movement rate.

effects.description: Move base Run rate plus 2m per hit

combat.name: Call a Shot
combat.description: Declare a specific target location for your next attack with various penalties and effects.

effects.description: Next attack targets a specific location

combat.name: Drop Object
combat.description: Drop an item you are currently holding.

effects.description: Object is dropped and no longer held

combat.name: Drop Prone
combat.description: Drop to the ground, gaining benefits against ranged attacks but penalties to melee defense.

effects.description: Character becomes prone

combat.name: Run
combat.description: Move at running pace (4x Walk rate) as a Free Action.

effects.description: Move at running pace

combat.name: Speak/Text/Transmit Phrase
combat.description: Speak a short phrase, send a text, or transmit a brief message.

combat.name: Multiple Attacks
combat.description: Declare intention to split dice pool for multiple attacks this action phase.

effects.description: Dice pool will be split among multiple attacks

combat.name: Dodge
combat.description: Add your Gymnastics skill to your defense test against a single attack.

effects.description: Add Gymnastics rating to defense pool

combat.name: Block
combat.description: Use Unarmed Combat skill to add to defense against a melee attack.

prerequisites.description: Must be aware of the attack

effects.description: Add Unarmed Combat rating to defense pool

combat.name: Parry
combat.description: Use your melee weapon skill to add to defense against a melee attack.

prerequisites.description: Must have a readied melee weapon
Must be aware of the attack

effects.description: Add weapon skill rating to defense pool

combat.name: Full Defense
combat.description: Add Willpower to all defense tests until your next action.

effects.description: Add Willpower to all defense tests until your next action

combat.name: Hit the Dirt
combat.description: Drop prone and add Willpower to defense against a ranged attack.

effects.description: Character becomes prone
Add Willpower to defense against this attack

combat.name: Intercept
combat.description: Move to block an opponent trying to move past you, preventing their movement.

effects.description: Target's movement is stopped

general.name: Perception Test
general.description: Make a general Perception test to notice something in your environment.

general.name: Use Simple Device
general.description: Use a simple device like a button, switch, or trigger.

general.name: Use Skill
general.description: Use any skill that requires a Complex Action to perform.

general.name: Pick Up / Put Down Object
general.description: Pick up an object from the ground or put one down.
